column4: howdy, does anyone know how to mount an .iso file without burning it to a cd?
Yeah.  You can use "sudo mount -o loop"
Note that the mount point must exist before you mount it
thanks, i had one thing wrong, i was using the -t option with iso9660
Ahh, ok.  That should work out for you then; the -o thing
lol, that's the internet for you.
I'm not entirely sure what it does.  I jus tknow that it mounts ISOs!  XD
haha, if it works, dont screw with it!
If it's too big, use rsync instead.  Even if it crashes, you can just run the same command again and it'll pick up where you left off.
lebowski: Oh yeah, he has a good point.  rsync will act funny if you go ext3 --> fat32
how do i check, its an external HD
